pizza.message

Class PizzaMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • pizza.message.PizzaMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfirmationMessage, MenuMessage, MenuRequestMessage, OrderMessage

    public abstract class PizzaMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Base class for all of the message types exchanged during operations of the Pizza Protocol. Human-readable encoding of a PizzaMessage is defined as follows:

    Message Type
    <Specific content encoding of the message subclass >
    Message type codes are:
       1 = Menu request
       2 = Menu message
       3 = Order message
       4 = Confirmation message

    Consult the documentation of the subclasses for their specific encodings.Each specific encoding terminates with the word "END" on a line by itself.
    Author:
    drdan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageType

        public int getMessageType()

      • reconstitute

        public static PizzaMessage reconstitute(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> representation)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a list of lines into an object. The specific class of the return object is determined from the representation
        Parameters:
        representation - a list of human readable lines
        Returns:
        an object of the class specified by 'representation'
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if representation does not correspond to a valid representation of any PizzaMessage subtype

      • encoding

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> encoding()
        Returns a human-readable representation of this object.
